pxchat.gui
Class I18n

java.lang.Object
  pxchat.gui.I18n

public final class I18n
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides the application with translated content.

Author:
Florian Bausch

textComps

private java.util.HashMap<javax.swing.AbstractButton,java.lang.String> textComps
A list of components that have a text. It will be set by calling AbstractButton.setText(String).

toolComps

private java.util.HashMap<javax.swing.JComponent,java.lang.String> toolComps
A list of components that have a tooltip. It will be set by calling JComponent.setToolTipText(String).

titleComps

private java.util.HashMap<java.awt.Frame,java.lang.String> titleComps
A list of components that have a title. It will be set by calling Frame.setTitle(String).

getString

public java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String key)
Returns the value associated with the specified key. If no value is available, "!!key!!" is returned.

Parameters:

The value associated with the key

setLocale

public void setLocale(java.util.Locale locale,
                      boolean updateConfig)
Sets a new locale for the application and loads the appropriate resource bundle. Updates the config, if updateConfig is true.

Parameters:
locale - The new locale
updateConfig - true if the config should be updated.

updateComponents

Sets the text content of all registered components to the current locales values.

getLanguages

public java.util.Set<java.util.Locale> getLanguages()
Retrieves the languages for which there exists a property file in /data/lang/.

Returns:
A mapping of the locale object to its language string

getLocaleFromString

public static java.util.Locale getLocaleFromString(java.lang.String localeString)
Convert a string based locale into a Locale Object. Assumes the string has form "{language}_{country}_{variant}". Examples: "en", "de_DE", "_GB", "en_US_WIN", "de__POSIX", "fr_MAC"

Parameters:
localeString - The String
Returns:
the Locale
